decks.notes: The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Show and Tell deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces of Show and Tell, Omniscience, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to cheat out the massive Eldrazi creature and win the game in a single turn. The deck aims to use cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to find the combo pieces quickly, while also running a suite of counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo from disruption. Ancient Tomb provides additional mana acceleration to help cast the expensive spells.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, while putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Broadside Bombardiers. By using fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's options and finish the game quickly with powerful threats. This strategy is designed to quickly overwhelm the opponent and prevent them from stabilizing or casting their spells effectively.

The deck revolves around the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Green Sun's Zenith, and Knight of the Reliquary to find and assemble the combo quickly. It also includes utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith for protection and disruption. The deck has a strong mana base with lands like Ancient Tomb and Mox Diamond to ramp up quickly. It has some graveyard recursion with Life from the Loam and ways to protect the combo with cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Endurance.

The deck focuses on using efficient and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure early in the game. It also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and control the board. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game by utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to set up draws and maximize card advantage. Its mana base is streamlined to support its aggressive strategy, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements and graveyard synergies to disrupt opponents and ramp quickly into powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary. By recurring lands with Life from the Loam and utilizing cards like Crop Rotation, the deck aims to quickly assemble powerful land combinations such as Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Swords to Plowshares and Sylvan Safekeeper to deal with threats and protect key pieces. The inclusion of utility lands like Karakas and Maze of Ith further enhances the deck's control elements.

This deck focuses on utilizing fast mana sources like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox to quickly ramp up and play powerful Goblin creatures like Muxus, Goblin Grandee and Goblin Rabblemaster. City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb help to accelerate mana production even further. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Goblins, supported by cards like Battle Cry Goblin and Legion Warboss to push through damage. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Shatterskull Smashing provide removal and unconditional damage.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by utilizing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Solitude. Additionally, the deck aims to control the board with cards like Karakas and Skyclave Apparition, ultimately leading to a victory through incremental advantage and out-valuing the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion adds an additional layer of value and flexibility to the deck.
